column68: BIG is a group of 500+ architects, engineers, urbanists, inventors, researchers and business minds from all over the world who are based in our Copenhagen, New York, London and Barcelona offices. Our built work ranges from the most diverse urban playground and Michelin-star dining - to affordable housing and a school among the verdant fjords of the Faroe Islands. We are dedicated to maintaining a cool workplace, at becoming better and better at what we do. Read more about us on Big.dk

column99: Bjarke Ingels Group is looking for a Head of People
column100:
BIG (Bjarke Ingels Group) is an international architectural company characterized by an entrepreneurial spirit, true teamwork across expertise areas and new ways of approaching conventional tasks. We have an informal work environment where camaraderie and collegial support are highly valued and where ambition, very high work morale and dedication to being the innovators of our field unify our staff. Our office culture is characterized by creativity, high energy and a strong team spirit. We are dedicated to creating and maintaining a cool workplace where we want to be and work continuously at becoming better and better at what we do. We are a company experiencing steady growth, and as we grow we also strive to mature. We have over the past 15 years developed from a 10 to a 650 people organization with offices in New York, London, Barcelona, Shenzhen and Copenhagen. The position as Head of People in our Copenhagen office has recently become vacant and we are now looking to fill this position.  As Head of People, you will report to our Managing Director and become the head of our Copenhagen based People team. You will act as the People Team responsible in the Copenhagen office (comprising of 320 employees) and you will be overseeing and taking part in all day-to-day People related tasks from recruitment, management of existing employee contracts and all employee related matters such as immigration, developing and maintaining organizational standards, wellbeing, reporting of People data to the Managing Director etc. Overall, you will experience a great degree of independence in a flexible and dynamic environment and the role will offer great exposure to all People disciplines – which by the way we are expanding upon as we grow. This will be a unique opportunity to be part of shaping People in a young, fast pace global organization. Primary areas of responsibility As Head of People, you and the current People team consisting of two full time employees and a student aid, will be overall responsible for all employee related matters in the Copenhagen office and throughout the entire employee life cycle. This includes (but is not limited to): 
 
 Leadership and management of the team ensuring each team member is aware of their priorities, focus and responsibilities and that the team functions daily 
 Be a representative of BIG values and ambitions 
 Act as the chief liaison to IT and other departments in regard to HR software system requirements 
 Implement and manage regular feedback loops for our staff 
 Manage department budget and annual planning of duties and new initiatives as well as resource planning 
 Ensure compliance with external regulations and union agreements 
 Interact with Partners, Managing Director and other senior staff in all employee related matters 
 Support Finance team with salary, leave and pension related matters 
 Support in the development and hosting of leadership training modules with management teams 
 Oversee development of initiatives for all staff members, using workshops and set up employee funds standards 
 Execute our annual wheel activities including e.g., It is a plus to have familiarity with the Architect union agreement in Denmark or similar union agreements salary regulation process, performance calibration, development feedback 
 Work on implementing new initiatives in the Copenhagen office 
 Promote collaboration with other departments in BIG and across our offices and bridge opportunities to develop processes and efficiencies in our global organization 
 Act as sparring Partner to our offices in Barcelona and Shenzhen 
 
 The ideal candidate: 
 
 Holds a Master within a relevant field 
 Has minimum 5 years of experience working with operational HR in larger and/or creative organizations 
 Has previously worked with global HRIS or similar HR IT systems 
 Enjoys a busy and creative environment with many nationalities 
 It is a plus to have familiarity with the Architect union agreement in Denmark or similar union agreements 
 Is structured and has excellent time management skills 
 Is comfortable with fast-paced decisions and rapidly changing environments 
 Has good communication skills and is fluent in English and Danish 
 
 We wish to fill this position asap so do not delay with your application! Have you any questions, please contact, People Coordinator Simon Lücking, +45 24298339 or at  simonl@big.dk Apply via our website at  www.big.dk/#jobs .
